intro: Halimocnemis tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan halimocnemis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in a disc-like structure, typical of the Asteraceae family. Halimocnemis tianschanica is often found in alpine meadows and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance in arid and semi-arid regions.
